reviews.text: Superb accommodation with curtious and friendly management , all this is just a short stroll from the fabulous astra pub/ restaurant .............. try it you will not be disapointed . All the best from the motor bike boys and girls .
reviews.title: BELIEVE THE REVIEWS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel certainly deserves the rating. We agree with everything the previous reviewer said about the room. The barbecue facilities were great too.
reviews.title: What a Gem!

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights with friends and wished we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Broken Hill!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to Michael for all your advice about accommodation in Hahndorf and Glenelg and to Michelle for being so friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: If only more motels were like this...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to stay at this motel, make sure you book in advance as it is so popular you might miss out. Can't wait to return.
reviews.title: An absolute must stay in Broken Hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As every other reviewer has said, this is a stunning, as-new motel in Broken Hill. We had a studio apartment for $140 per night. This really felt like an apartment with a king size bed, walk-in robe and good bathroom up one end and a living, dining, kitchen area up the other end. The only thing that the kitchen didn’t have was a stove, but with a fridge, microwave, toaster, kettle, coffee plunger and a full range of dishes and utensils, we had everything we needed (some of the other apartments do have stoves). There is also a large TV with lots of Pay channels and good wireless internet access. An easy walk to a few restaurants - the owners recommended The Astra to us which was indeed good. Definitely the place to stay in Broken Hill, but book ahead - not surprisingly they’re busy!
reviews.title: As good as it gets

reviews.text: Being a small family with an eleven month old we needed a clean place for her to crawl and play on. We had looked at loads of accomodation but found the reviews for the Red Earth to be amazing, so I booked and was also given an upgrade to a spa apartment. WOW. So clean, so new, plus the most comfortable king size bed. It was great to do a days exploring to come back to a spa and relax. Red Earth also allowed us the use of a cot which they beautifully made up for our daughter. Defiantly our pick for Broken Hill.
reviews.title: Best in Broken Hill

reviews.text: I stayed here last year for 4 days . I cant speak highly enough of the Red Earth .
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to stay

reviews.text: Comfortable rooms that were very clean and the owners were extremely hospitable . I highly recommend.
reviews.title: New, clean and ideal location

reviews.text: New, clean and ideal location. If only it was summer, I would of used the pool.
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided at the last minute to visit Broken Hill. It wasn't school holidays so we didn't book anything. We looked at a horrible musty smelly B&B full of old furniture and could not get out of there quickly enough. So I looked up tripadvisor and found the great reviews of Red Earth Motel. I rang, the person was incredibly helpful and offered to save the room for us, and let us have a look before committing. Well, it took only a quick glance to realise we had found an absolute gem. It is very new, apartment-style, with a shady swimming pool. Calling it a "motel" is doing it a disservice - this is probably one of the best apartment accommodation complexes I have ever seen. The smallest "studio" apartment was huge with an open plan living/dining/kitchenette (with full size fridge), plus a separate sleeping area with a king bed and a bathroom. The bed was quite simply the most comfortable I have ever slept on. I am a guidebook author on boutique accommodation around Australia so I have slept in more beds than most people! Red Earth Motel is one of those rare finds - I wish every country town had a "motel" like this one! I didn't see the larger apartments, but if the studio was anything to go by, they would also be sensational and perfect for longer stays, families or groups travelling together.
reviews.title: Probably the best accommodation in Broken Hill - we loved it!

reviews.text: From the first point of contact I was impressed and it only got better on arrival at Red Earth.
reviews.title: Immaculate in Every Aspect

reviews.text: The 2 Bedroom Apartment was perfect with everything you could want. Large spotlessly clean kitchen, dining and Lounge area. The bathroom has a large double shower. The bedrooms are also large with King Beds that are so comfortable you won't want to get out , (pillow topped mattress topper ) and great quality linen. The decor is light and bright and well designed. All the mod cons and of course air-conditioning .
reviews.title: A real treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool and surrounds are also great !!
reviews.title: Wonderful accommodation in Broken Hill

reviews.text: Special note : Great for families also . We will definitely be back !!
reviews.title: Creme de la creme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW! If you are travelling to Broken Hill you must stay in this family run motel! We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment. It was huge and beautifully decorated, modern and well appointed. There was a walk in robe, large bathroom, big screen TV and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in (king size!). The motel is in the centre of town, close to all of the tourist attractions.and the family who run it are just gorgeous.
reviews.title: Best in Broken Hill!!

reviews.text: When we return to Broken Hill Red Earth Motel is on the top of our list. Don't stay in one of the pubs, where the noise from downstairs filters up and keeps you awake all night!
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else in Broken Hill
New
reviews.text: Thanks!!!

I was told by a local that Red Earth is the first motel as you come in on the road from Sydney (via Wilcannia), and for me there's a reason why this place is so popular. Room facilities above average & tastefully set up, walking distance to some great pubs/clubs for dinner & drinks and all the staff very friendly and welcoming. The bed was so comfortable, the room very clean and the motel itself is relatively new.
reviews.title: Excellent motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very highly recommend Red Earth as the place to stay in Broken Hill.
reviews.title: Ditto ditto Best motel in town
